let me show you the simplest and
probably my favorite way to use this to
create a simple but amazing pan sauce
after cooking some meat so step one fry
some meat in a pan this is a piece of
hanger steak but it could be any other
kind of steak or pork chop or chicken
breast and once the meats cooked all we
need to do is throw in a chunk of
demi-glace and I'm just going to do a
single portion which would be about half
one of those blocks we made and really
all you need to do is toss it in and
reduce it by about half and like any
kind of liquid we put into a saute pan
it's going to melt that found off the
bottom all that caramelized goodness and
once that's happened and like I said
it's reduced by roughly half or to your
desired consistency we'll turn off the
heat and that's it except for one very
major step remember this demi is not
seasoned no salt no pepper no nothing so
I'm going to put a pinch of salt and a
little bit of freshly ground black
pepper and we'll stir that around and
believe it or not that's it
we'll simply spoon that over our meat
and even in its most primitive form just
simply reduced with salt and pepper it
is such an unbelievably fantastic sauce
until you actually experience this
yourself you really can't understand the
magnitude of its perfection in addition
to its intensely savory flavor it also
has this incredibly luxurious mouthfeel
kind of halfway between sticky and silky
that's just to die for
